sections.name: Primal Bandersnatch
sections.html: Primal bandersnatches are among the most powerful of their kind, due to their ties to the First World.

sections.name: Bandersnatch
sections.html: Bandersnatches are consummate hunters, and only the deadliest predators or the most cunning intelligent prey offer them sport. A bandersnatch resembles a tawny, six-legged, earless great cat, but with wickedly barbed quills running the length of its body and down to the tip of its long, flexible tail. It measures 40 feet in length plus another 10 feet of tail and weighs 12,000 pounds.

traits.name: Gargantuan
traits.text: *Space:* 20 feet or more, *Reach (Tall):* 20 feet, *Reach (Long):* 15 feet

traits.name: Beast
traits.text: A creature similar to an animal but with an Intelligence modifier of –3 or higher is usually a beast. Unlike an animal, a beast might be able to speak and reason.

traits.name: Tane
traits.text: The Tane are powerful creatures created eons ago by the Eldest of the First World. All of the Tane treat whatever plane they happen to be on as their home plane.

modifiers.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

automatic_abilities.name: Planar Acclimation
automatic_abilities.text: The bandersnatch treats the plane it is on as its home plane.

automatic_abilities.name: Confusing Gaze

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item or a creature with a strong alignment.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature's emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target's mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

automatic_abilities.text: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become confused for 1 round.

automatic_abilities.name: Quick Recovery
automatic_abilities.text: The bandersnatch recovers with frightening speed. At the end of its turn, it reduces the value of one debilitating condition it suffers (with the exception of dying) by 1. If it's blinded, dazzled, deafened, fatigued, fleeing, or petrified, it can instead succeed at a DC 16 flat check to end one of these conditions of its choice; it can't use quick recovery on other conditions that lack values.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Deadly
traits.text: On a critical hit, the weapon adds a weapon damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon's damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a _greater striking rune_ and three dice if the weapon has a _major striking rune_. For instance, a rapier with a _greater striking rune_ deals 2d8 extra piercing damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon's normal damage dice doesn't change the size of its deadly die.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

ability.name: Focus Gaze

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature's emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target's mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

ability.text: The bandersnatch fixes its gaze at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against the bandersnatch's confusing gaze. After attempting the save, the creature is temporarily immune to a bandersnatch's Confusing Gaze gaze until the start of the bandersnatch's next turn.

ability.name: Frumious Charge
ability.text: The bandersnatch Strides, ignoring difficult terrain, then makes two claw Strikes at the end of its movement.

ability.name: Lash Out
ability.text: At the start of its turn, the bandersnatch gains an additional reaction that can be used only to attempt an Attack of Opportunity.

ability.name: Pain
ability.text: A bandersnatch's quills create exceptionally painful wounds. The wounded creature must succeed at a DC 41 Fortitude save to resist becoming drained 1 (drained 2 on a critical failure) by this pain. Further bandersnatch Strikes that cause pain increase the amount of drain by 1 for each failed save to a maximum of drained 4.

ability.name: Relentless Tracker
ability.text: The bandersnatch can Track while moving at its full speed.

offensive_actions.name: Warning - this sidebar contains spoilers for the Kingmaker adventure path.

ability.name: Warning - this sidebar contains spoilers for the Kingmaker adventure path.
ability.text: The bandersnatch presented here is a creature that retains its ties to the First World, known to some scholars as primal bandersnatches. Bandersnatches who have dwelt on the Material Plane for longer periods can be less dangerous, although it's unheard of for a bandersnatch to weaken below 13th level. Just as surely, even more powerful bandersnatches lie in wait in the deepest reaches of the First World.
